1. Bill Miller is a legendary value investor who has announced his plans to retire at the end of 2022.
2. Miller's flagship mutual fund, Miller Opportunity Trust, has had poor performance in 2021, losing 37% and placing it in the bottom quartile of the Mid-Cap Blend category.
3. Despite this poor performance, Miller remains committed to his investing strategy and has recently added to his holdings of Amazon and Silvergate Capital.
4. He is also a fan of Delta Air Lines and has Bitcoin as one of his top personal holdings.
5. Miller plans to remain engaged in markets even after his retirement, but will not have the overall responsibility for managing other people's money.
6. He believes that the current market environment is similar to 1990, when he took over management of Legg Mason's equity funds and had two consecutive years of poor performance.
7. Miller believes that the Federal Reserve's handling of inflation has caused problems in the market, but he remains optimistic about the long-term growth of the US economy.
8. He predicts that the stock market will be higher in 2023 and that Amazon's stock has the potential to double within the next three years due to the success of its AWS and advertising businesses.
9. He also thinks that sports leagues, such as the NFL and NBA, could be good investments due to the growth of sports betting and the increasing popularity of sports.
10. Miller advises investors to focus on companies with a competitive advantage and to have a long-term perspective.
